Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an assault on human rights and the sovereignty of the Australian people.
The proposal infringes on the right to freedom of thought, opinion, and expression.
The government and media being exempt from the draft is problematic.
The legislation is compared to the beginnings of a totalitarian regime.
Main Themes: Exemption of government and media from regulations
Notable Quotes: This is a direct assault on the human rights and the sovereign people of Australia.
A totalitarian regime starts with one party controlling the Media.
